param.name: no_mixed
param.label: Disable alignments of individual mates
param.help: By default, when hisat cannot find a concordant or discordant alignment for a pair, it then tries to find alignments for the individual mates. This option disables that behavior. (--no-mixed)

param.name: no_discordant
param.label: Disable discordant alignments
param.help: By default, hisat looks for discordant alignments if it cannot find any concordant alignments. A discordant alignment is an alignment where both mates align uniquely, but that does not satisfy the paired-end constraints (--fr/--rf/--ff, -I, -X). This option disables that behavior. (--no-discordant)

param.name: skip_reverse
param.label: Skip reference strand of reference
param.help: (--norc) If --norc is specified, hisat will not attempt to align unpaired reads against the reverse-complement (Crick) reference strand. In paired-end mode, --nofw and --norc pertain to the fragments; i.e. specifying --nofw causes hisat to explore only those paired-end configurations corresponding to fragments from the reverse-complement (Crick) strand.
